member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.CrossFirebaseFirestore.IsSupported
member.summary: Gets if the plugin is supported on the current platform.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.CrossFirebaseFirestore.Current
member.summary: Current plugin implementation to use

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.CrossFirebaseFirestore.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose of everything

member.name: T:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FieldValue
member.summary: Sentinel values that can be used when writing document fields with Set() or Update().

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FieldValue.ArrayUnion(System.Object[])
member.summary: Returns a special value that can be used with Set() or Update() that tells the server to union the given elements with any array value that already exists on the server. Each specified element that doesn't already exist in the array will be added to the end. If the field being modified is not already an array it will be overwritten with an array containing exactly the specified elements.
member.param: The elements to union into the array.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FieldValue.ArrayRemove(System.Object[])
member.summary: Returns a special value that can be used with Set() or Update() that tells the server to remove the given elements from any array value that already exists on the server. All instances of each element specified will be removed from the array. If the field being modified is not already an array it will be overwritten with an empty array.
member.param: The elements to union into the array.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FieldValue.IntegerIncrement(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a special value that can be used with Set() or Update() that tells the server to increment the field's current value by the given value.
member.param: The value to increment.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FieldValue.DoubleIncrement(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a special value that can be used with Set() or Update() that tells the server to increment the field's current value by the given value.
member.param: The value to increment.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FieldValue.Delete
member.summary: Returns a sentinel for use with Update() to mark a field for deletion.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FieldValue.ServerTimestamp
member.summary: Returns a sentinel for use with Set() or Update() to include a server-generated timestamp in the written data.

member.name: T:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FirestoreSettings
member.summary: Settings used to configure a IFirebaseFirestore instance.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FirestoreSettings.Host

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FirestoreSettings.IsPersistenceEnabled

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FirestoreSettings.IsSslEnabled
member.summary: Returns whether or not to use SSL for communication.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FirestoreSettings.CacheSizeBytes
member.summary: Returns the threshold for the cache size above which the SDK will attempt to collect the least recently used documents.

member.name: T:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.ICollectionReference
member.summary: A ICollectionReference object can be used for adding documents, getting document references, and querying for documents (using the methods inherited from IQuery).

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.ICollectionReference.GetDocument(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a IDocumentReference object referring to the document at the specified path, relative to this collection’s own path.
member.param: The slash-separated relative path of the document for which to get a IDocumentReference object.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.ICollectionReference.CreateDocument
member.summary: Returns a IDocumentReference object pointing to a new document with an auto-generated ID.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.ICollectionReference.AddDocumentAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a new document to this collection with the specified data, assigning it a document ID automatically.
member.param: An object containing the data for the new document.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.ICollectionReference.Parent
member.summary: A reference to the document to which this ICollectionReference belongs.

member.name: T:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentReference
member.summary: A IDocumentReference object refers to a document location in a Firestore database and can be used to write, read, or listen to the location. The document at the referenced location may or may not exist. A IDocumentReference object can also be used to create a FIRCollectionReference to a subcollection.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentReference.SetDataAsync(System.Object,Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.SetOptions)
member.summary: Writes to the document referred to by this IDocumentReference. If the document does not yet exist, it will be created. If you pass SetOptions, the provided data can be merged into an existing document.
member.param: The data to write to the document.
An object to configure the set behavior.

member.summary: Writes to the document referred to by this IDocumentReference. If the document does not yet exist, it will be created. If you pass SetOptions, the provided data can be merged into an existing document.
member.param: The data to write to the document.
An object to configure the set behavior.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentReference.SetDataAsync(System.ValueTuple{System.Object,System.Object}[])
member.summary: Writes to the document referred to by this IDocumentReference. If the document does not yet exist, it will be created. If you pass SetOptions, the provided data can be merged into an existing document.
member.param: The data to write to the document.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentReference.SetDataAsync(Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.SetOptions,System.ValueTuple{System.Object,System.Object}[])
member.summary: Writes to the document referred to by this IDocumentReference. If the document does not yet exist, it will be created. If you pass SetOptions, the provided data can be merged into an existing document.
member.param: An object to configure the set behavior.
The data to write to the document.

member.summary: Updates fields in the document referred to by this IDocumentReference object. If the document does not exist, the update fails.
member.param: The data to write to the document.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentReference.UpdateDataAsync(System.ValueTuple{System.String,System.Object}[])
member.summary: Updates fields in the document referred to by this IDocumentReference object. If the document does not exist, the update fails.
member.param: The data to write to the document.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentReference.DeleteDocumentAsync
member.summary: Deletes the document referred to by this IDocumentReference.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentReference.GetDocumentSnapshotAsync``1(Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.Source)
member.summary: Reads the document referenced by this IDocumentReference. This method attempts to provide up-to-date data when possible by waiting for data from the server, but it may return cached data or fail if you are offline and the server cannot be reached.
member.param: A value to configure the get behavior.
member.typeparam: The type of the document item.

Gets invoked when something went wrong.

member.summary: Gets a ICollectionReference object referring to the collection at the specified path within this IDocumentReference.
member.param: The slash-separated path of the collection for which to get a ICollectionReference.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentReference.Id
member.summary: The ID of the document referred to.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentReference.Path
member.summary: A string representing the path of the referenced document (relative to the root of the database).

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentReference.Parent
member.summary: A reference to the collection to which this IDocumentReference belongs.

member.name: T:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentSnapshot`1
member.summary: A IDocumentSnapshot object contains data read from a document in your Firestore database. The data can be extracted with the data property. For a IDocumentSnapshot object that points to a non-existing document, any data access will return null. You can use the exists property to explicitly verify a documents existence.
member.typeparam: The type of the document item.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentSnapshot`1.Data
member.summary: Retrieves all fields in the document as the given generic type. Returns null if the document doesn't exist.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentSnapshot`1.Metadata
member.summary: Metadata about this snapshot concerning its source and if it has local modifications.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentSnapshot`1.Reference
member.summary: A IDocumentReference object to the document location.

member.name: T:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IFirebaseFirestore
member.summary: Represents a Firestore Database and is the entry point for all Firestore operations.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IFirebaseFirestore.GetCollectionGroup(System.String)
member.summary: Creates and returns a new IQuery object that includes all documents in the database that are contained.
member.param: The collectionId of the collection or subcollection.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IFirebaseFirestore.GetCollection(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a ICollectionReference object referring to the collection at the specified path within the database.
member.param: The slash-separated path of the collection for which to get a ICollectionReference.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IFirebaseFirestore.GetDocument(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a IDocumentReference object referring to the document at the specified path within the database.
member.param: The slash-separated path of the document for which to get a IDocumentReference.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IFirebaseFirestore.RunTransactionAsync``1(System.Func{Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.ITransaction,``0})
member.summary: Executes the given updateBlock and then attempts to commit the changes applied within an atomic transaction.
member.param: The func to execute within the transaction context.
member.typeparam: The type of the result returned by updateFunc.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IFirebaseFirestore.CreateBatch
member.summary: Creates a write batch, used for performing multiple writes as a single atomic operation.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IFirebaseFirestore.WaitForPendingWritesAsync
member.summary:
Waits until all currently pending writes for the active user have been acknowledged by the backend.
The returned Task completes immediately if there are no outstanding writes. Otherwise, the Task waits for all previously issued writes (including those written in a previous app session), but it does not wait for writes that were added after the method is called. If you wish to wait for additional writes, you have to call WaitForPendingWritesAsync() again.
Any outstanding WaitForPendingWritesAsync() Tasks are cancelled during user changes.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IFirebaseFirestore.DisableNetworkAsync
member.summary: Disables network access for this instance. While the network is disabled, any snapshot listeners or get() calls will return results from cache, and any write operations will be queued until network usage is re-enabled via a call to enableNetwork

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IFirebaseFirestore.EnableNetworkAsync
member.summary: Re-enables network usage for this instance after a prior call to DisableNetworkAsync.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IFirebaseFirestore.ClearPersistenceAsync
member.summary:
Clears the persistent storage, including pending writes and cached documents.
Must be called while the IFirebaseFirestore instance is not started (after the app is shutdown or when the app is first initialized). On startup, this method must be called before other methods (other than setting FirestoreSettings). If the IFirebaseFirestore instance is still running, the Task will fail with an error code of FAILED_PRECONDITION.
Note: ClearPersistenceAsync() is primarily intended to help write reliable tests that use Cloud Firestore. It uses an efficient mechanism for dropping existing data but does not attempt to securely overwrite or otherwise make cached data unrecoverable. For applications that are sensitive to the disclosure of cached data in between user sessions, we strongly recommend not enabling persistence at all.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IFirebaseFirestore.TerminateAsync
member.summary:
Terminates this IFirebaseFirestore instance.
After calling TerminateAsync() only the ClearPersistenceAsync() method may be used. Any other method will throw an IllegalStateException.
To restart after termination, simply call the Restart() method.
TerminateAsync() does not cancel any pending writes and any tasks that are awaiting a response from the server will not be resolved. The next time you start this instance, it will resume attempting to send these writes to the server.
Note: Under normal circumstances, calling TerminateAsync() is not required. This method is useful only when you want to force this instance to release all of its resources or in combination with ClearPersistenceAsync() to ensure that all local state is destroyed between test runs.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IFirebaseFirestore.Restart
member.summary: Should be used after TerminateAsync() was called to restart the IFirebaseFirestore instance.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IFirebaseFirestore.UseEmulator(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Modifies this FirebaseDatabase instance to communicate with the Cloud Firestore emulator. Note: Call this method before using the instance to do any database operations.
member.param: The emulator host (for example, 10.0.2.2 on android and localhost on iOS)
The emulator port (for example, 8080)

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IFirebaseFirestore.Settings
member.summary: Custom settings used to configure this IFirebaseFirestore object.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.WhereArrayContains(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Creates and returns a new IQuery with the additional filter that documents must contain the specified field, it must be an array, and the array must contain the provided value.
A query can have only one arrayContains filter.
member.param: The name of the field containing an array to search
The value that must be contained in the array

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.WhereArrayContains(Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FieldPath,System.Object)
member.summary:
Creates and returns a new IQuery with the additional filter that documents must contain the specified field, it must be an array, and the array must contain the provided value.
A query can have only one arrayContains filter.
member.param: The path of the field containing an array to search
The value that must be contained in the array

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.WhereArrayContainsAny(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Creates and returns a new IQuery with the additional filter that documents must contain the specified field, the value must be an array, and that array must contain at least one value from the provided array.
A query can have only one ArrayContainsAny filter and it cannot be combined with ArrayContains or in filters.
member.param: The name of the field containing an array to search.
The array that contains the values to match.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.WhereArrayContainsAny(Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FieldPath,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Creates and returns a new IQuery with the additional filter that documents must contain the specified field, the value must be an array, and that array must contain at least one value from the provided array.
A query can have only one ArrayContainsAny filter and it cannot be combined with ArrayContains or in filters.
member.param: The path of the field containing an array to search.
The array that contains the values to match.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.WhereFieldIn(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Creates and returns a new IQuery with the additional filter that documents must contain the specified field and the value must equal one of the values from the provided array.
A query can have only one in filter, and it cannot be combined with an arrayContainsAny filter.
member.param: The name of the field to search.
The array that contains the values to match.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.WhereFieldIn(Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FieldPath,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Creates and returns a new IQuery with the additional filter that documents must contain the specified field and the value must equal one of the values from the provided array.
A query can have only one in filter, and it cannot be combined with an arrayContainsAny filter.
member.param: The name of the field to search.
The array that contains the values to match.

member.summary: Creates and returns a new IQuery object that’s additionally sorted by the specified field.
member.param: The field to sort by.
Whether to sort descending.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.OrderBy(Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.FieldPath,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates and returns a new IQuery object that’s additionally sorted by the specified field.
member.param: The path to sort by.
Whether to sort descending.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.StartingAt(System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates and returns a new IQuery object that starts at the provided fields relative to the order of the query. The order of the field values must match the order of the order by clauses of the query.
member.param: The field values to start this query at, in order of the query’s order by.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.StartingAt(Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentSnapshot)
member.summary: Creates and returns a new IQuery object that starts at the provided document (inclusive). The starting position is relative to the order of the query. The document must contain all of the fields provided in the orderBy of this query.
member.param: The snapshot of the document to start at.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.StartingAfter(System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates and returns a new IQuery object that starts after the provided fields relative to the order of the query. The order of the field values must match the order of the order by clauses of the query.
member.param: The field values to start this query after, in order of the query’s order by.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.StartingAfter(Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentSnapshot)
member.summary: Creates and returns a new IQuery object that starts after the provided document (exclusive). The starting position is relative to the order of the query. The document must contain all of the fields provided in the orderBy of this query.
member.param: The snapshot of the document to start after.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.EndingAt(System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates and returns a new IQuery object that ends at the provided fields relative to the order of the query. The order of the field values must match the order of the order by clauses of the query.
member.param: The field values to end this query at, in order of the query’s order by.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.EndingAt(Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentSnapshot)
member.summary: Creates and returns a new IQuery object that ends at the provided document (exclusive). The end position is relative to the order of the query. The document must contain all of the fields provided in the orderBy of this query.
member.param: The snapshot of the document to end at.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.EndingBefore(System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates and returns a new IQuery object that ends before the provided fields relative to the order of the query. The order of the field values must match the order of the order by clauses of the query.
member.param: The field values to end this query before, in order of the query’s order by.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.EndingBefore(Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentSnapshot)
member.summary: Creates and returns a new IQuery object that ends before the provided document (exclusive). The end position is relative to the order of the query. The document must contain all of the fields provided in the orderBy of this query.
member.param: The snapshot of the document to end before.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.LimitedTo(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates and returns a new IQuery object that only returns the first matching documents up to the specified number.
member.param: The maximum number of items to return.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuery.LimitedToLast(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates and returns a new IQuery object that only returns the last matching documents up to the specified number. A query with a LimitedToLast(limit) clause must have at least one orderBy clause.
member.param: The maximum number of items to return.

member.summary: Reads the documents matching this query. This method attempts to provide up-to-date data when possible by waiting for data from the server, but it may return cached data or fail if you are offline and the server cannot be reached.

member.typeparam: The type of the document items.

Gets invoked when something went wrong.
Whether metadata-only changes (i.e. only IDocumentSnapshot.Metadata changed) should trigger snapshot events.
member.typeparam: The type of the document item.

member.summary: A IQuerySnapshot contains zero or more IDocumentSnapshot objects.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuerySnapshot`1.GetDocumentChanges(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an enumerable of the documents that changed since the last snapshot. If this is the first snapshot, all documents will be in the list as Added changes.
member.param: Whether metadata-only changes (i.e. only IDocumentSnapshot.Metadata changed) should be included.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuerySnapshot`1.Documents
member.summary: An enumerable of the IDocumentSnapshots that make up this document set.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuerySnapshot`1.Metadata
member.summary: Metadata about this snapshot, concerning its source and if it has local modifications.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuerySnapshot`1.DocumentChanges
member.summary: An enumerable of the documents that changed since the last snapshot. If this is the first snapshot, all documents will be in the list as Added changes.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuerySnapshot`1.Query
member.summary: The query on which you called in order to get this IQuerySnapshot.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuerySnapshot`1.IsEmpty
member.summary: Indicates whether this IQuerySnapshot is empty (contains no documents).

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IQuerySnapshot`1.Count
member.summary: The count of documents in this IQuerySnapshot.

member.name: T:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.ISnapshotMetadata
member.summary: Metadata about a snapshot, describing the state of the snapshot.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.ISnapshotMetadata.HasPendingWrites
member.summary: Returns true if the snapshot contains the result of local writes (e.g. set() or update() calls) that have not yet been committed to the backend. If your listener has opted into metadata updates (via includeMetadataChanges:true) you will receive another snapshot with hasPendingWrites equal to false once the writes have been committed to the backend.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.ISnapshotMetadata.IsFromCache
member.summary: Returns true if the snapshot was created from cached data rather than guaranteed up-to-date server data. If your listener has opted into metadata updates you will receive another snapshot with IsFromCache equal to false once the client has received up-to-date data from the backend.

member.name: T:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.ITransaction
member.summary: ITransaction provides methods to read and write data within a transaction.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.ITransaction.GetDocument``1(Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentReference)
member.summary: Reads the document referenced by document.
member.param: A reference to the document to be read.
member.typeparam: The type of the document item.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.ITransaction.SetData(Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentReference,System.Object,Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.SetOptions)
member.summary: Writes to the document referred to by the provided IDocumentReference object. If the document does not yet exist, it will be created. If you pass SetOptions, the provided data can be merged into an existing document.
member.param: The IDocumentReference to overwrite.
The data to write to the document.
An object to configure the set behavior.
member.returns: This ITransaction instance. Used for chaining method calls.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.ITransaction.SetData(Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentReference,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object},Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.SetOptions)
member.summary: Writes to the document referred to by the provided IDocumentReference object. If the document does not yet exist, it will be created. If you pass SetOptions, the provided data can be merged into an existing document.
member.param: The IDocumentReference to overwrite.
The data to write to the document.
An object to configure the set behavior.
member.returns: This ITransaction instance. Used for chaining method calls.

member.name: T:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IWriteBatch
member.summary: A write batch is used to perform multiple writes as a single atomic unit. A IWriteBatch object can be acquired by calling IFirebaseFirestore.CreateBatch(). It provides methods for adding writes to the write batch. None of the writes will be committed (or visible locally) until IWriteBatch.CommitAsync() is called. Unlike transactions, write batches are persisted offline and therefore are preferable when you don’t need to condition your writes on read data.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IWriteBatch.SetData(Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IDocumentReference,System.Object,Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.SetOptions)
member.summary: Writes to the document referred to by the provided IDocumentReference. If the document does not yet exist, it will be created. If you pass SetOptions, the provided data can be merged into an existing document.
member.param: The IDocumentReference to overwrite.
The data to write to the document.
An object to configure the set behavior.
member.returns: This IWriteBatch instance. Used for chaining method calls.

An object to configure the set behavior.
member.returns: This IWriteBatch instance. Used for chaining method calls.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IWriteBatch.CommitAsync
member.summary: Commits all of the writes in this write batch as a single atomic unit.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.IWriteBatch.CommitLocal
member.summary: Commits all of the writes in this write batch as a single atomic unit. Returns immediately, without waiting for the commit to complete.

member.name: T:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.SetOptions
member.summary: An options object that configures the behavior of Set() calls. By providing one of the SetOptions objects returned by Merge(), MergeFields(fields) and MergeFieldPaths(fieldPaths), the Set() calls in IDocumentReference, WriteBatch and Transaction can be configured to perform granular merges instead of overwriting the target documents in their entirety.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.SetOptions.Merge
member.summary: Changes the behavior of Set() calls to only replace the values specified in its data argument. Fields omitted from the Set() call will remain untouched.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.SetOptions.MergeFieldPaths(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String}})
member.summary: Changes the behavior of Set() calls to only replace the given fields. Any field that is not specified in fields is ignored and remains untouched. It is an error to pass a SetOptions object to a Set() call that is missing a value for any of the fields specified here in its to data argument.
member.param: The list of fields to merge.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.SetOptions.MergeFields(System.String[])
member.summary: Changes the behavior of Set() calls to only replace the given fields. Any field that is not specified in fields is ignored and remains untouched. It is an error to pass a SetOptions object to a Set() call that is missing a value for any of the fields specified here.
member.param: The list of fields to merge. Fields can contain dots to reference nested fields within the document.

member.name: M:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.SetOptions.MergeFields(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary: Changes the behavior of Set() calls to only replace the given fields. Any field that is not specified in fields is ignored and remains untouched. It is an error to pass a SetOptions object to a Set() call that is missing a value for any of the fields specified here.
member.param: The list of fields to merge. Fields can contain dots to reference nested fields within the document.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.SetOptions.Type
member.summary: The type of the merge as integer (TypeMerge = 0, TypeMergeFieldPaths = 1, TypeMergeFields = 2)

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.SetOptions.FieldPaths
member.summary: The list of fields to merge.

member.name: P:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.SetOptions.Fields
member.summary: The list of fields to merge.

member.name: T:Plugin.Firebase.Firestore.Source
member.summary: Configures the behavior of Get() calls on IDocumentReference and IQuery. By providing a Source value, these methods can be configured to fetch results only from the server, only from the local cache, or attempt to fetch results from the server and fall back to the cache (which is the default).
